title: How to Use HTTrack in 9 Simple Steps

steps.title: Install HTTrack.
steps.content: Install HTTrack. You can download it from https://www.httrack.com . The software is available on both Windows and Linux.

steps.title: Open HTTrack and choose a project name.
steps.content: Open HTTrack and choose a project name. This will be the name of the folder containing your project. One project can include copies of multiple websites.

steps.title: Optionally, enter a base path.
steps.content: Optionally, enter a base path. The default path creates a websites directory in your home directory, but you can choose another location if you'd like.

steps.title: Select an action.
steps.content: Select an action. Click the menu at the top, and choose the option that fits what you want to do. The most common options are: Chose Download web site(s) to mirror a website with its default options. Choose Download website(s) + questions if you want to be prompted about links to download. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Enter the URL(s) of the websites you want to mirror.
steps.content: Enter the URL(s) of the websites you want to mirror. If you're downloading multiple websites, place each URL on a separate line. You can click Set optionsâ€¦ to choose other options, including certain file types to download or skip, recursion preferences, and the address of your proxy server.

steps.title: Choose your final preferences and click Finish.
steps.content: Choose your final preferences and click Finish . If you want, you can choose options such as delaying the start of the downloading or disconnecting when finished first.

steps.title: Watch the site(s) download in real time.
steps.content: Watch the site(s) download in real time. HTTrack will now download the websites you entered with your preferred preferences.
